result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Alex Pimental was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 90 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION,
Court advised that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation on case 14CM1554.  
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.

Consecutive to: Consecutive.  Forthwith.  Credit for 46 days.
 Huber privileges for only BIP & AODA ordered in case 14CM1554, but only after eight (8) months.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed and returned state's photographs.
AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 90 DAYS time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSTION. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation on case 14CM1554. Court WAIVED all non mandatory court costs fees, and surcharges. 
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

AS TO COUNT 5
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 46 DAYS time served, consecutive, FORTHWITH, with Huber Release for ONLY BIP & AODA ordered in case 14CM1554, BUT ONLY AFTER 8 MONTHS. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation on case 14CM1554. Court WAIVED all non mandatory court costs fees, and surcharges. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Attorney Ronald C. Shikora in court, defendant Joseph Alex Pimental not in court, in custody.  Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Branch 23 is in trial, no spins available. Case adjourend to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CASE RECALLED
Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered counts dismissed, but read in.
AS TO COUNTS 4 & 5
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing. Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ronald C. Shikora in court, defendant Joseph Alex Pimental not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1st call, parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ronald C. Shikora in court, defendant Joseph Alex Pimental not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 08/04/2014.
Received & Filed, State's Amended Witness List.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List, State's Motions In Limine, and State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Case rescheduled to 7/24/2014 at 1:30 pm for Final Pretrial, from 7/25/2014 at 8:30 am at parties request. Parties advised of change of court date.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in court with attorney Ronald C Shikora.  Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #11CM2835 & 14CM1554 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Ratkowski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Discussion regarding court assignment of this case, matter to remain in branch 23. Court Granted JOINDER of 14CM1554 &14CF1803 for trial. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Aimee S., Michael P., Shane S. and Sharon L.

Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Joseph Alex Pimental in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to assignment of lower pending misdemeanor case. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 4 and 5.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1965 South Muskego Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
